title: Doctor makes desperate call for help after ‘chaotic’ weekend in Manitoba ER
description: A desperate call for help is being made by a doctor from Manitoba's second-largest emergency department.

title: Judge in Quebec racial profiling case orders end to random traffic stops by police
description: The challenge heard this year was brought by Joseph-Christopher Luamba, a Black Montreal resident who said he had been stopped by police nearly a dozen times without reason.

title: Defeated Brampton mayoral candidate Nikki Kaur ‘terminated’ as city employee
description: In an email sent to Brampton councillors on Tuesday, chief administrative officer Paul Morrison said Kaur is "no longer working for the city."

title: Frost Regina will be back in February for a 2nd time
description: Frost Regina is a winter festival filled with various activities and events that spans over 10 days in four hub locations will return on February 3 - 12, 2023.

title: Private endangered species charges against Ontario cabinet minister dropped
description: An Ontario town says private charges that alleged a provincial cabinet minister harmed a threatened turtle species while he was mayor have been dropped.

title: Alfredsson honoured to go into Hockey Hall of Fame
description: When Daniel Alfredsson arrived in Ottawa in the fall of 1995, that 22-year-old would have never believed he'd one day find himself in the Hockey Hall of Fame.

title: Regina Police Service introduces Community Crime Map
description: Regina police announced the release of a new community crime map allowing Regina residents to get a visual perspective of the crime happening in the city and to take precautions.

title: Manitoba premier says decision yet to be made on timing of next election
description: Under provincial law, the election is scheduled for next Oct. 3, although governments are allowed to call the vote earlier.

title: Winnipeg’s NFI Group talks supply chain issues, financial losses
description: NFI Group vice-president of Strategy and Investor Relations Stephen King told 680 CJOB Tuesday morning a lack of specialty parts is making it harder to complete orders on time.

title: London, Ont. man faces child porn charges following tip from Alberta authorities
description: Between Sept. 23 and Oct. 25, police say they charged Micheal Jordan Blunte-Dittmer, 31, with 19 offences after searching a home on Adelaide Street North.

title: B.C.’s top 5 most wanted criminals remain on the lam this Halloween
description: Anonymous tips about most wanted men may be submitted via Crime Stoppers’ downloadable 'P3' app for Apple and Android phones, or by calling Crime Stoppers at 1-800-222-8477 (TIPS).

title: 2-alarm fire breaks out at Vancouver Street Church previously targeted by arson
description: Crews were called to the Vancouver Street Church around noon to reports of smoke. Another fire broke out in the same building in July, which is now being probed as an arson.

title: Police urge vigilance on the roads after driver hits child in Saanich, B.C. crosswalk
description: Police are reminding drivers to exercise caution and watch the roads in dark, wet weather after a child was struck in a marked crosswalk in Saanich on Tuesday.

title: 2020 shooting linked to Richmond double homicide months later: police
description: A shooting involving three vehicles in December 2020 has now been linked to the slaying of two brothers in Richmond several months later.

title: Carolina Hurricanes hand winless Vancouver Canucks seventh straight loss
description: The Canucks were outplayed in Monday's home-ice loss, with Carolina outshooting Vancouver 39-16, including 15-3 in the third period.

title: Kelowna bus killer’s latest bail release discussed at B.C. legislature
description: BC Liberals say they are concerned about 'catch and release' issues within the courts, using Kelowna criminal Tyler Jack Newton's lengthy record as an example.

title: Canadian women released from camp for ISIS detainees in Syria
description: B.C. and Quebec women expected to return to Canada tonight.

title: Heavy snowfall in forecast for Highway 3: Environment Canada
description: Snowfall will be heaviest after midnight, then ease Wednesday morning as the low exits the province.

title: In-person Diwali celebrations return to B.C. after pandemic hiatus
description: Gurdwaras and Mandirs across the province were busy Monday, as people brought goods and sweets, and lit Diyas, small lamps representing the triumph of light over dark.

title: B.C. reaches temporary deal with paramedics aimed at boosting rural staffing
description: The agreement will significantly boost the pay rural and remote paramedics receive while on-call, and offer overtime at double pay rates in certain circumstances.

title: Saskatoon police further investigate teen's death that family believes is suspicious
description: A Saskatoon father says police are taking further action in the investigation of his teen son’s death.

title: Beleaguered Warman clinic reopen after emergency closure
description: Legends Medical Clinic in Warman reopened to the public today, nearly two weeks after shutting its door to walk-in patients due to a physician shortage and abusive behaviour towards staff and doctors.

title: Moe talks immigration, energy in Saskatoon throne speech preview
description: Premier Scott Moe gave a sneak peek of what will be coming out of Wednesday’s throne speech on Monday afternoon in Saskatoon.

title: 'I could represent myself': Greg Fertuck’s lawyers walk out of the courtroom
description: After investing more than 500 hours into Greg Fertuck’s case, both of his lawyers walked out of the courtroom, mid murder trial.

title: Prince Albert looking to build permanent shelter for city’s homeless
description: The City of Prince Albert is looking to the Saskatoon Tribal Council as a role model in its quest to develop a permanent shelter for the city's homeless population.

title: Expect no revelations from Saskatoon administration report on Donauer: Solicitor
description: City council won’t learn anything new when a report providing options available to council surrounding allegations facing councillor Randy Donauer is revealed next month.

title: FSIN pays tribute to families of victims in James Smith attacks
description: On Sunday members of the Federation of Sovereign Indigenous Nations (FSIN) paid tribute to the families of James Smith Cree Nation at the annual Spirit of Our Nations Pow wow.

title: New boundaries coming for Saskatoon's electoral wards
description: The map of Saskatoon's municipal wards is about to be redrawn

title: 'I fell in love with it': Saskatoon boxing champ. trains the next generation
description: Gary “Hocus Pocus” Kopas is the first to admit he got in too many fights growing up.

title: Travel advisories in effect as vast region of southern Sask. hit with snow
description: The province experienced its first full taste of the 2022 winter season on Sunday, with snow falling over a vast swath of southern Saskatchewan.

title: Ontario announces sweeping housing changes that allow three units on one property
description: The Ontario government announced sweeping housing changes on Tuesday that will override municipal zoning laws in some situations and allow for the construction of up to three units on each residential lot.

title: New details reveal how the alleged 'crypto king' scheme left investors out millions
description: A self-described 'crypto king' from Ontario was living a lavish life – driving a lime green Lamborghini and boating on a multi-levelled yacht – before an investor alleged the 23-year-old had scammed him out of millions.

title: 'It is exciting': Ausma Malik to become first hijab-wearing Muslim woman to sit on Toronto city council
description: There will be nine new faces on Toronto’s city council this year, including the first hijab-wearing Muslim councillor elected to office, Ausma Malik.

title: Now might be the best time of year to find a new rental in Toronto. Here's why
description: According to one Toronto real estate agent, you can actually use the observed lack of demand in the fall to play the field and lock down a lease on your own terms.

title: Pearson Airport tries out runway inspections powered by drones and AI
description: Pearson is testing out new technology aimed at speeding up runway inspections to make Canada’s busiest airport even busier.

title: Peel police investigation leads to the seizure of $25 million worth of drugs
description: An investigation by Peel Regional Police has lead to the seizure of $25 million dollars worth of narcotics, as well as numerous arrests.

title: Ontario's foreign buyers tax hike won't have much affect on already cooling market: experts
description: Housing industry observers say Ontario's surprise move Monday to increase the tax paid by foreign homebuyers to 25 per cent won't have much affect on the province's already-cooling market.

title: Toronto voter turnout appears poised to hit a new record low
description: Toronto’s voter turnout appears poised to hit a new record low following a municipal election campaign which lacked a high-profile challenger to John Tory.

title: Service Canada doubled its efforts in summer to reduce passport wait times; did it work?
description: After many Canadians were frustrated with long passport wait times earlier this year, Service Canada doubled its efforts by hiring more staff to expedite processing times. A CTVNews.ca analysis shows it led to an 87% increase in passports issued in October, compared to May, when the backlog was at its worst.

title: 5 things John Tory said he would do after winning a third term as mayor of Toronto
description: Mayor John Tory was back at his desk bright and early Tuesday morning after handily winning a third term as mayor the night before.

description: The Greater Essex County District School Board is reviewing its community police programs and is asking for feedback from the community.

A CTVNews.ca analysis shows it led to an 87% increase in passports issued in October, compared to May, when the backlog was at its worst.

title: Woman scammed out of $8,000 in Chatham-Kent: CKPS
